title: Drawing, "Project for a slightly varied suggestion for the upper part of the pedestal and the figure with the dial in 1938-88-2109", 1790–1820
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite, on paper
markings: Recto and Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: The number of the festoons (cf. 1938-88-2109) is augmented. The steps leading to the base with the figures are increased from two to three. Animal masks and garlands decorate the base. Atop the base is a circular clock face with Roman numerals and arrow-shaped hand, flanked by two griffins, and presented by a nude woman in an Egyptian headdress.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for a slightly varied suggestion for the upper part of the pedestal and the figure with the dial in 1938-88-2109", 1790–1820.
1790–1820. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite, on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-1524.
